summary: The White Oak Resilience Act aims to restore and regenerate white oak forests across the United States. It establishes a White Oak Restoration Initiative Coalition to coordinate efforts, authorizes pilot projects within the Forest Service and Department of Interior, and directs the Secretary of Agriculture to create the White Oak and Upland Oak Habitat Regeneration Program. The bill focuses on research, seedling production, and technical assistance to support white oak conservation on federal, tribal, state, and private lands, with sunset provisions for several sections.
